installation.h3: Importing all the commits from GitHub and BitBucket

installation.p: Yes, that's also possible. I [built a tool which downloads and then imports all the commits you have pushed to GitHub and BitBucket](https://github.com/IonicaBizau/repository-downloader)!

installation.h3: What about the GitHub Contributions calendar?

installation.p: If you want to visualize the calendars that appear on GitHub profiles, you can do that using [`ghcal`](https://github.com/IonicaBizau/ghcal).

p: For more detailed documentation, check out the repository: https://github.com/IonicaBizau/ghcal.
If want to get even more GitHub stats in your terminal, you may want to try [`github-stats`](https://github.com/IonicaBizau/github-stats)--this is like `git-stats` but with data taken from GitHub.
You can tweak the git-stats behavior using a configuration file in your home directory: `~/.git-stats-config.js`.
This file should export an object, like below (defaults are listed):

installation.p: Since it's a js file, you can `require` any other modules there.

p: `git-stats` is working fine in terminal emulators supporting ANSI styles. It should work fine on Linux and OS X.
If you run `git-stats` to display graph on Windows, please use a terminal that can properly display ANSI colors.
Cygwin Terminal is known to work, while Windows Command Prompt and Git Bash do not. Improvements are more than welcome! :dizzy:
